page.title: 16Biography Of Famous Artist
page.content: Almost all his paintings describe mining life around the 1920's.Mr.Evans rarely chooses comfortable poses.He mostly works on deploreable conditions e.g.cramped positions,disasters, lockouts and the soup kitchens. Religous atrocities against the Jews is also one of his favourite subjects. Mr.Evans was not taught how to paint.He devised his own unique design and has used it ever since. Mr.Evans frequently gives lectures at universities and has very little recreation.In his spare time he exercises "Sheba"his yellow labrador dog. His "works of art"have been received by numerous stately homes and museums including The National Museum of Wales and the Duke of Devonshire's house.Some of his paintings have been received in the U.S.A. and Europe.
